question: Which curated data resources for ChIP-seq data are available?
ideal_answer: The MGA repository, Cistrome Data Browser, CR Cistrome and GeneProf data.

snippets.text: MGA repository: a curated data resource for ChIP-seq and other genome annotated data.

The Mass Genome Annotation (MGA) repository is a resource designed to store published next generation sequencing data and other genome annotation data (such as gene start sites, SNPs, etc.) in a completely standardised format.
Cistrome Data Browser: a data portal for ChIP-Seq and chromatin accessibility data in human and mouse.

To overcome this challenge, we built the Cistrome database, a collection of ChIP-seq and chromatin accessibility data (DNase-seq and ATAC-seq) published before January 1, 2016, including 13 366 human and 9953 mouse samples. All the data have been carefully curated and processed with a streamlined analysis pipeline and evaluated with comprehensive quality control metrics. We have also created a user-friendly web server for data query, exploration and visualization. The resulting Cistrome DB (Cistrome Data Browser), available online at http://cistrome.org/db, is expected to become a valuable resource for transcriptional and epigenetic regulation studies.
CR Cistrome: a ChIP-Seq database for chromatin regulators and histone modification linkages in human and mouse.
GeneProf data: a resource of curated, integrated and reusable high-throughput genomics experiments.
CR Cistrome: a ChIP-Seq database for chromatin regulators and histone modification linkages in human and mouse.Diversified histone modifications (HMs) are essential epigenetic features.

exact_answer: MGA repository, Cistrome Data Browser, CR Cistrome, GeneProf data
